RMPDescription: Puerto Rico - Anhydrous Ammonia and Chlorine

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1.  The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at the facility:
The Linde Gas Puerto Rico, Inc. facility located in Catano, Puerto Rico complies with applicable requirements for toxic substances and it is our policy to adhere to all applicable federal and local laws.  If an emergency accidental release were to occur involving our anhydrous ammonia or chlorine storage/handling systems, it is our policy to immediately notify the Catano Fire Department and the Linde Gas Emergency Response Team, who would respond to the emergency.

2.  A description of the facility and the regulated substances handled:
The Linde Gas Puerto Rico, Inc. facility stores anhydrous ammonia in above ground storage tanks (ASTs).  The liquified gas is transferred into storage cylinders of various sizes before they are sold and shipped from the facility.   The anhydrous ammonia storage/handling processes consists of two 6,000-gallon ammonia ASTs, cylinder filling equipment, filled cylinders of various sizes, and associated piping, valves, and other miscellaneous equipment.  Chlorine is also stored at the Linde Gas Puerto Rico facility in cylinders only.  The cylinders are transported to the facility, stored for a period of time, and then shipped from the facility.  Propane is no longer stored at the Linde Gas Puerto Rico facility.

3.  The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps:
The Linde Gas Puerto Rico facility complies with USEPA's accident prevention rule and all applicable federal and local codes and regulations.  

4.  Five-year accident history:
The Linde Gas Puerto Rico facility has never had an accident involving its ammonia or chlorine storage/handling processes.  

5.  The emergency response program:
In the event of an emergency accidental release involving our covered processes, it is Linde Gas' policy to immediately notify the Catano Fire Department and Linde Gas Puerto Rico Emergency Response Team, who would respon

d to the emergency.  We have communicated this policy with the Catano Fire Department.  All members of the Linde Gas Puerto Rico Emergency Response Team are properly trained to respond to emergencies at the facility.  All employees have access to Linde Gas' emergency action plan.  Emergency response training is conducted annually.  

6.  Planned changes to improve safety:          NONE
